instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic (go figure)
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> experiencing kernel panic,

As you have recommended online I replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> with Poly Cap, scaped pads to fit larger cap, everything went well, no excessive heat required, no other parts burned;

Since replacing, I cannot get board to turn on;

I have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, PP3V42 (and green light), and all S5 rails

L9560 to gnd presents 110ohms, I noticed in diode mode there is only 0.07 drop from L9560 to gnd which is pin 7 of <TRANSISTOR>Q9560</TRANSISTOR>.  Schematic shows diode here so I expect to see .6 ish v drop.

Not sure is maybe I messed up <TRANSISTOR>Q9560</TRANSISTOR> but can see how it would prevent turn on if no short present.

I was careful to no allow mush heat near CPU, however its likely some flux/alcohol got under it, I applied a slight amount of heat so flow/dry anything under CPU but no where near enough to reflow the CPU.

Any Idea's?

BTW - Have been watching your utube vid's, great stuff, thanks

Bruce

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic (go figure)
threads.message: Are you using a REAL 85W charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic (go figure)
threads.message: Yes.  It worked fine prior to <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> replacement.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic (go figure)
threads.message: Wow, just tried another Flapple 85w charger and low and behold...FAN SPIN...Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic (go figure)
threads.message: So I am wondering, would I have seen Adapter Sence on One Wire if I had checked?  I didnt think to try that since I had PP3V42

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic (go figure)
threads.message: All voltages will be normal, it will just not power on. It should power on from a battery though.
